question: A ________ is a running program managed by the operating system.
The OS assigns a unique identifier called ________ to each process.
A process in the ________ state is waiting for CPU execution.
When a process is currently being executed by the CPU, it is in the ________ state.
A process moves to the ________ state when it has completed execution.
The Process Control Block (PCB) stores important information about a ________.
The ________ stores the memory address of the next instruction to be executed.
A process that is waiting for a resource moves to the ________ state.
The OS manages multiple processes at the same time to ensure ________.
Each PCB stores the ________ of the process, which determines its execution stage.
